title: Installation issue: Axom and Conduit on Cray
body:
Facing issues building Axom on Cori (Cray XC40). MPI issues for building Conduit (dependency) as well as Axom. I have created one issue, since I see the same error for both packages.

Error message for Conduit:
`-- Could NOT find MPI_C (missing: MPI_C_LIB_NAMES) (found version "3.1")` similarly for CXX and Fortan. Build log attached.
[conduit-spack-build-out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/5446835/conduit-spack-build-out.txt)

I circumvent this error by using #19513, which essentially side-steps the spack wrapper. Following this I face an error of a similar nature in the Axom package

Error message for Axom:
`-- Could NOT find MPI_C (missing: MPI_C_LIB_NAMES) (found version "3.1")` similarly for CXX and Fortan. Build log attached.
[axom-spack-build-out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/5446901/axom-spack-build-out.txt)

I circumvent this error by using #19514 which again side-steps the spack wrapper and successfully builds Axom. However, it might be better to figure out the underlying issue. In case I am doing something wrong.

`spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.15.4-1680-7313cf5ea
* **Python:** 3.6.10
* **Platform:** cray-sles15-haswell
`


Steps to reproduce the issue
1. `module swap intel/19.0.3.199 intel/19.1.2.254` (not necessary, however, I am building E4S with this version)
2. `git clone https://github.com/spack/spack ~/spack`
3. `. ~/spack/share/spack/setup-env.sh`
4. Create ~/.spack/cray/compilers.yaml and ~/.spack/packages.yaml (attached)
5. `export CC=$(which cc) && export CXX=$(which CC) && export FC=$(which ftn)` (redundant since this is set in compilers.yaml as well)
6. `spack install axom@0.3.3 %intel@19.1.2.254`

Yaml files:
[compilers.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/5445815/compilers.txt)
[packages.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/5445820/packages.txt)
